file_content.text: Ah, there she is! This, my fellows, is the future of the Sith Order! Who will lead the Empire into a new moment.
Ah, there he is! This, my fellows, is the future of the Sith Order! Who will lead the Empire into a new moment.
What is a no-name Sith Lord going to do against a Dark Council member? Thanaton will have our heads.
Thanaton grows more insufferable every day. Our "ancient and mystical Sith traditions" will win wars, he says. Not generals with training.
Darth Thanaton may be wrong, but he is still your better. You will show respect.
Do not insult Thanaton.
Of course, my lord.
Don't worry. The next time I meet Thanaton, he will die.
He'll be gone soon enough.
Then talk to me after he's dead. I won't stick my head out until I know it won't get cut off.
Enough, Dolus. We're not here to listen to you bicker.
Moff Pyron, if you please.
Ahem.
Yes, let's quiet down. The Sith is not here to listen to your bickering.
We're here today to demonstrate a new weapon, code name "Silencer." You boys may have heard of it.
What are you drinking, Pyron? Thanaton killed the Silencer project.
Soon you will see an entire Republic fleet disappear, thanks to the Silencer and the tireless efforts of the Empire's champion. My lord?
Moffs, Generals. We are an empire at war to reclaim our rightful place in the galaxy.
For the Empire!
We cannot afford to be the same Empire we were before we returned to this space.
We must be strong, determined, and above all, free to do what is necessary to claim victory.
Moffs, Generals. Today you will see who holds the real power in the Sith Empire.
I am your new master!
Not the Dark Council, not Thanaton. Me.
When I finish my ascent, all will bow or face my might.
Let's just get this done.
I'm in a hurry.
Eisek, prepare the Silencer to fire.
Moff Pyron, my lord. We're receiving an Imperial signal.
Doombringer. Darth Achelon of the Carnage requests your aid in fighting the Republic fleet. Repeat: The Carnage needs your aid.
Let's blast that fleet out of the sky. Use the weapon.
Fire the Silencer.
No, wait. If you fire the Silencer now, the Carnage and Achelon will be destroyed in the blast.
Who is this Darth Achelon?
Darth Achelon?
Moff Pyron, I thought you had this worked out.
Was this part of the plan?
This was not part of the plan.
Darth Achelon is one of Thanaton's cronies. Let him get blasted.
You would knowingly destroy an Imperial vessel? You propose treason, Graham.
The fleet will tear him to shreds anyhow. If we go in there, that'll be two Imperial vessels destroyed. My lord?
If Achelon wants help, he'll get it. Not that it'll do him any good. Use the weapon.
Let Achelon burn. Fire it.
We're not following them anywhere.
Let them die.
Yes, my lord. Awaiting your orders.
My lord, the Carnage just got blown to pieces. The Republic fleet is clear.
Then fire the Silencer.
Fire!
You know what to do.
Whenever you're ready.
Let's finish this fleet off.
Goodbye, Republic.
Yes, my lord.
Amazing. I can't believe my eyes.
Tell the Carnage that we'll take care of the fleet, but they must retreat to safe range.
Time to be the heroes.
Yes, my lord. Captain, relay the message.
The Carnage is moving out of range, my lord. We have a clear shot at the enemy fleet....
Blow the fleet to pieces.
Take it.
Make sure you have plenty of room, then fire.
Wait.
Let's show Darth Achelon who the real power is. Fire the Silencer.
Send a message to Achelon.
Captain, fire the Silencer.
Aye, aye, sir.
Doombringer. This is the Carnage. What just happened?
That fleet would have torn you to pieces.
We saved your life.
Did you like my new weapon? I built it myself. Well, almost.
It's called the Silencer.
Just a little display of power for my new allies.
I couldn't resist showing off.
Doombringer. This is Darth Achelon. Whose idea was it to fire that weapon on the Republic fleet?
Ah, the little upstart Thanaton wants dead. Hmph. I should blast you out of space, but you saved my life and the lives of my crew. Goodbye.
Unbelievable. Achelon's not usually one for backing down.
I agree. You've made quite the impression, my lord. Consider us interested in an alliance of sorts.
Moff Pyron, see that each of these men gets a Silencer for his capital ship. I expect this will be a quite fruitful relationship.
Excellent.
Moff Pyron, will you handle the details?
Speak with Pyron.
Of course, my lord.
I hope I will give you no cause to regret it.
I appreciate it.
If Thanaton has anything that can out-class the Silencer on his side, well, I'm betting my life he doesn't.
Come, gentleman. We have much to discuss.
My lord. Moff Valion Pyron. I am satisfied to report that the Silencer is complete.
But we have limited time to test it before Thanaton intervenes. The prototype is mounted aboard the Imperial starship Doombringer.
Meet me there. I have already invited the Moffs I feel would be most favorable to your cause. It falls to you to do the persuading.
Good work, Moff Pyron. I will meet you there.
Excellent.
Excellent. I'll have you know Imperial engineering has outdone themselves.
I still have some business to settle, but I'll be there shortly.
Give me a minute.
Of course, my lord. I will complete the preparations.
Why can't you fire the weapon? I have better things to do.
No, thank you.
It would be best if the Moffs saw you do it yourself. It gives the appearance of involvement, patriotism.
I shall see you aboard the Doombringer.
My lord. You're very efficient.
I promised you my respect and support, but you have also gained my admiration.
I trust you've heard the bad news. Darth Thanaton's superior on the Dark Council died--mysteriously. Darth Thanaton has succeeded him.
His insistence on killing me has made one thing clear: Turning back is not an option.
It won't stop me.
I'm guessing I don't want to know why this is so terrible.
What does that mean?
The Dark Council are the galaxy's most powerful Sith. Thanaton will have access to all resources in his pyramid of the Sith hierarchy.
I assure you my loyalty is secure, but I don't know how the other Moffs will feel about opposing a Dark Council member.
Then when I kill him, I will be a Dark Council member.
Better for me.
Only if the Dark Council doesn't catch you--isn't that how it works?
I admire your determination, but I don't know how the other Moffs will feel about opposing one of the galaxy's twelve most powerful Sith.
Now, more than ever, the Silencer must be completed and you must take the credit. The Moffs must see the true future of the Sith Empire.
Let me know when the weapon is completed. I will fire it myself.
Absolutely.
When I kill Thanaton, none of this will matter.
They will see eventually.
Then let us hope you kill him soon.
What's your investment in this again?
Why do you care?
If it weren't for Sith tradition, we would've crushed the Republic when we had the chance. Thanaton is old blood.
I will contact you when the weapon is ready for demonstration. Good luck, my lord.
My lord, the Belsavis machine. It's made you better, but it wasn't enough to drive the voices from your head, was it?
It doesn't matter. I've gotten used to it.
They're not so bad.
Do you have a solution?
Why do you ask?
I can't take much more of this, truth be told.
It's driving me crazy.
Zash is indisposed at the moment. But we still have the writings of Darth Vilus.
We should go to Voss. Your body is cured, but Master Ryen always said, a Jedi's mind must be whole. It's the same for a Sith.
You can't face Thanaton until you can control the dead you've bound.
My lord. Moff Valion Pyron. I've heard much about you. I thought it was time we spoke.
I've been watching this conflict between you and Thanaton. I intend to be on the winning side.
Then you intend to support me.
Mine, then.
I hope to. But I must be sure.
Ah, you're calling to kiss my boots. Carry on.
Go ahead. Bow if you like.
No, I'm calling to give you an opportunity.
And which side have you deemed that to be?
Which is?
I don't know yet. However, Thanaton's particular old-fashioned philosophy cannot survive much longer, regardless.
You lack Imperial connection. But with the proper display of patriotism, you could easily win many of the Moffs to your side.
My loyalty to the Empire is unquestionable. It is my duty to serve.
I serve the Empire.
If only more Sith Lords thought like you.
Any thoughts?
I was brought into the Empire as a slave. I have no love for it.
Forget the Empire.
So long as you appear to love it, no one cares about the difference.
At Thanaton's behest, the Empire recently cut funding on a project called the Silencer, a superweapon capable of disintegrating an entire armada.
If an ambitious young Sith were to see the weapon to completion and then test-fire it on a Republic fleet, she would be well-regarded.
If an ambitious young Sith were to see the weapon to completion and then test-fire it on a Republic fleet, he would be well-regarded.
What's necessary to complete the weapon?
What do you need?
A sensor chip. The CN-12. Incredibly rare and powerful.
I'm guessing it takes more than sheer desire to complete this weapon.
I have plenty of ambition.
You're right. A special sensor chip--the CN-12--is required.
Are you asking for a donation?
I'm not exactly wealthy.
Yes, but not credits. A sensor chip. The CN-12.
The chip is only built on Nar Shaddaa. It's illegal in the Republic. In the Empire, it's--well, we don't use it lightly.
But I understand your little cult on Nar Shaddaa has moved into electronic weaponry, and is now the chief supplier of these chips.
I will consult my cult and see what we can do for you.
Of course. I'll speak to them.
I'm pleased to hear it.
Consider it thought about.
I trust you will.
I thought they were a bunch of lunatics who worshiped me. No one ever told me they were productive members of society.
My cult is doing what?
Perhaps it's time to see what your leadership has created.
Now if you'll excuse me, I have this business of the war to attend to.
